image.altText: Anthony Albanese sings with a Matilda scarf around his neck

props.synopsis: The PM suggests Australians should buy local goods instead of American ones ahead of a federal budget expected to have an "Australian-made" theme.

title.children: Albanese invokes 'Team Australia' in pitch to buy local after Trump tariffs

image.altText: A women wearing chocolate brown top and skirt is holding the bottom of her belly.

props.synopsis: The Productivity Commission says governments are shirking "meaningful action" to close the gap, as new data shows only four of the national targets are on track.

title.children: ‘Definition of insanity’: Close the gap failures laid bare

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: The government is banking on voters appreciating that this time around with Trump is different.

title.children: A stark pre-election divide has opened between Albanese and Dutton

image.altText: A man standing in front of a truck wearing a black top.

props.synopsis: A new report on Islamophobia in Australia has found a steep increase in assaults, abuse and threats.

title.children: Cars set alight, people hit, abuse on social media. Islamophobia is on the rise

image.altText: A man peers out from a large broken window.

props.synopsis: While both countries claim they want peace, there's previously been significant differences between what Kyiv and Moscow have said they'd be prepared to agree to, and there's still plenty that needs to happen before fighting stops.

title.children: Is a Ukraine-Russia ceasefire close? Here's what we know

image.altText: An aerial view of a smouldering, burnt out container ship out at sea.

props.synopsis: Police arrested the captain of the Solong container ship on Tuesday on suspicion of gross negligence and manslaughter.

title.children: Cargo ship captain arrested after UK tanker crash is a Russian national

image.altText: A flat lay of a calculator, an electricity bill and a mobile phone displaying an ABC article about electricity prices.

props.synopsis: Power prices are set to rise yet again, with the energy market regulator lifting the benchmarks for how much retailers can charge for electricity.

title.children: Power prices are set to rise as regulator tipped to hike benchmarks

image.altText: A prefab module for an apartment building.

props.synopsis: Prefab housing has been touted as the answer to Australia's housing supply for years, but it's an industry plagued with high costs, low scale and a desperate need for investment if it's ever going to be a solution.

title.children: Sweden builds houses in days, Australia tried to do that 50 years ago

image.altText: A journalist wears sunglasses, helmet and a vest with a "press" badge as he carries a camera tripod on his left shoulder.

props.synopsis: Afghans who fled after the Taliban takeover were all set for new lives in the United States until Donald Trump signed an executive order pausing the refugee program, leaving people with approved visas and booked flights dreading a return to Taliban rule.

title.children: Afghans who helped America fight the Taliban could be sent back

image.altText: ASX in Sydney

props.synopsis: The Australian share market futures are pointing to modest gains as US stocks recovered on a rally in the beaten down tech sector. Follow live.

title.children: ASX set to follow tech-led Wall St share rebound

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Tariff war heats up as Europe and Canada retaliate
US markets rebound on tech 'bargain hunting'

image.altText: A young man with dark hair and a beard stands outside a house in Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The former retail worker in Melbourne says the tech giant told him to stop wearing a pro-Palestinian necklace and bracelet because the jewellery made other employees and customers feel "unsafe" and "unwelcome".

title.children: Worker accuses Apple of discrimination over jewellery supporting Gaza

image.altText: Original fossil (ATE7-1) of the midface of a hominin.

props.synopsis: Bone fragments discovered in Spanish cave are putting a face to the earliest ancient humans to arrive in Western Europe, more than a million years ago.

title.children: Million-year-old face fossil discovered in cave

image.altText: People carry garbage bags picking up rubbish on a beach.

props.synopsis: Queensland's bay islands act as a natural buffer protecting the mainland from severe storm surges, and helped save Brisbane from the full force of Cyclone Alfred.

title.children: The islands that saved millions from Cyclone Alfred

image.altText: Rodrigo Duterte looks emotionlessly forward at the camera with short black hair

props.synopsis: The former Philippine president is expected to face a preliminary hearing in coming days.

title.children: Rodrigo Duterte lands in the Netherlands after 'war on drugs' arrest

image.altText: Plants in pots under lights in the green house.

props.synopsis: New costings estimate that legalising cannabis could add $700 million a year to the federal bottom line, but that number is far lower than previous estimates from the Parliamentary Budget Office.

title.children: Tax benefits of legal weed downgraded, but Greens vow to push ahead with policy

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

props.synopsis: The Prime Minister has agreed insurance companies are ripping us off. So, how will they respond as tens of thousands of claims are lodged after flooding in the wake of ex-Cyclone Alfred?

title.children: ABC News Daily: Can we afford ‘rip off’ insurance after Alfred?

image.altText: Cassandra smiles as she looks to the camera in a mid-shot. Her hair is curled in loose waves and she wears lipstick.

props.synopsis: As a bestselling author, Cassandra Clare has faced her fair share of controversy. Back with a new fantasy series that draws on her Jewish cultural background, she isn't letting potential reader reactions stop her from exploring complex themes in her work.

title.children: Why controversy follows fantasy author Cassandra Clare

image.altText: A woman and a child sit next to each other in a theatre

props.synopsis: A Victorian theatre company is letting audiences know when lights will flash or music will change abruptly or how people might react during certain moments.

title.children: Theatre group's additions help put neurodivergent audiences at ease

image.altText: Seven young people each holding a different giant foam letter to make up Heywire, jump in front of Parliament House.

props.synopsis: The ABC is calling on community organisations to help bring inspiring ideas developed by young people at this year's Heywire Regional Youth Summit to life.

title.children: Heywire grants on offer to help make 'incredible' regional ideas real

image.altText: Michael Zerafa celebrates

props.synopsis: Michael Zerafa has defeated Besir Ay in Sydney and still hopes to one day reignite an old rivalry with Tim Tszyu, but those hopes have been dismissed by his rival's camp.

title.children: Tim Tszyu on everyone's hit list after Thurman, Zerafa record wins

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump wearing a white shirt, blue suit jacket and yellow tie

props.synopsis: NASA has announced the dismissal of its chief scientist in its first round of cuts ordered by US President Donald Trump.

title.children: NASA loses chief scientist in first round of Trump-ordered cuts

image.altText: Damaged residential buildings after being hit with a missile

props.synopsis: Four civilians have been killed in a Ukrainian attack on Russia's western Kursk region, Russian officials say.

title.children: US arms flow to Ukraine again as Russia mulls ceasefire

image.altText: A man armed with a rifle wearing camouflage gear standing alongside a green and yellow passenger train carriage

props.synopsis: Pakistan authorities say the day-long stand off involving hundreds of hostages has ended.

title.children: Pakistan's army says 21 hostages dead after train siege ends

image.altText: Donald Trump standing in the Oval Office. To his left is Arthur Sinodinos and to his right, Arthur's wife Elizabeth.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese may be under attack from the Coalition, but former ambassador Arthur Sinodinos knows Donald Trump and believes the PM has taken the right approach to US tariffs.

title.children: 'Eyeball' Trump: Former ambassador's advice for Australia's next PM

image.altText: A smiling, dark-haired man with a beard — actor Leonardo DiCaprio.

props.synopsis: The Oscar-winning actor is not happy with the federal energy minister for signing off on a bauxite mine expansion that would see 3,855 hectares of native forest cleared.

title.children: Leonardo DiCaprio slams Australian government over mine expansion

image.altText: Full moon in cloudy sky above Byron Bay lighthouses

props.synopsis: While America is set to see an incredible "blood moon" this week, only a fraction of Australians will see a sliver of the final moments of a partial lunar eclipse. Here's when and what to look for if you are one of the lucky ones.

title.children: Millions will see a 'blood moon' eclipse this week. But what about Australia?

image.altText: A woman stands beside a hospital bed in a medical imaging room.

props.synopsis: When Rose Kruze started suffering from debilitating headaches, she had no idea they were a symptom of an under-diagnosed brain condition.

title.children: Retired nurse's crippling headaches lead to rare diagnosis

image.altText: A street with a sign saying "Karangi".

props.synopsis: Police say the women, 41 and 51, were present when a woman gave birth at a property near Coffs Harbour in 2022.

title.children: Women face manslaughter charges after death of baby born at home

image.altText: two women make the word love with their hands

props.synopsis: In its simplest form, the philosophy of RA rejects traditional relationship hierarchy and norms.

title.children: What is 'relationship anarchy' and can we all learn something from it?

image.altText: Michael Zerafa celebrates

props.synopsis: Michael Zerafa has defeated Besir Ay in Sydney and still hopes to one day reignite an old rivalry with Tim Tszyu, but those hopes have been dismissed by his rival's camp.

title.children: Tim Tszyu on everyone's hit list after Thurman, Zerafa record wins

image.altText: Adam Caporn talks with players

props.synopsis: After serving as an assistant under the previous two coaches, Adam Caporn has been promoted to the Australian men's basketball team head coach role.

title.children: Boomers name ex-assistant as new head coach

image.altText: Longmuir pic

props.synopsis: Two very different propositions face Western Australia's AFL sides as they enter season 2025. For Fremantle, it's time to deliver on undeniable potential, while for West Coast it's about regaining respect.

title.children: Dockers, Eagles aiming to shrug off disappointing seasons in AFL

image.altText: A close up photo of a 1967 Ford Falcon

props.synopsis: Ford Falcon GTs from across the country will be on display at the national car show in Shepparton.

title.children: Thousands of car lovers to descend on Shepparton for Ford Falcon GT event
